meanings.definition: To express great joy or happiness.
meanings.sent1: The children will jubilate when they see the circus.
meanings.sent2: People often jubilate at weddings and birthdays.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed to jubilate after finding its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden jubilate under the warm sun.
meanings.sent5: The students will jubilate when they hear about the surprise field trip.

meanings.sent1: The choir sang a beautiful jubilate during the church service.
meanings.sent2: The jubilate echoed through the halls of the cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to chirp along with the jubilate.
meanings.sent4: The jubilate filled the room with a sense of peace and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The jubilate played by the orchestra brought tears to many eyes.
